useCase.name: Activate and Arm
useCase.description: The UAV is prepped for flight, activated by turning 'safety' off, and finally armed.

preconditions.precondition: UAV has been prepped for flight with batteries, propellers, etc., and is airworthy
UAV has been placed at its launching location

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV passes arming checks and is armed for flight

failureEndConditions.condition: The UAV takes off without adequate arming checks

mainSequence.step: The RPIC deactivates the UAV's safety switch.
The UAV executes all pre-arming tests.
The UAV's status is set to MISSION mode (PX4=MISSION, Ardupilot=GUIDED/STABILIZED).
The UAV's automated pilot notifies DroneResponse that the UAV is armed for flight.

esteps.description: The RPIC fails to deactivate the safety switch
esteps.step: The UAV issues a warning sound and raises an error when the arming command is attempted.
The use case continues from Step 1.

esteps.description: The UAV fails to pass its pre-arming tests
esteps.step: The system reports specific reasons for pre-arming failure.
The RPIC reactivates the UAV's safety switch.
A technician attempts to fix the root cause of the pre-arming failure (e.g., recalibrating the UAV).
If the technician fixes the problem, the use case restarts from Step 1.
If the technician fails to fix the problem, the UAV is removed from service.
